Key Arguments: The bill is unnecessary and contradicts the principles of freedom of the press and democratic values.
It places an undue burden on independent media organizations, journalists, and bloggers by imposing complex reporting standards.
The bill selectively excludes government-authorized publications from scrutiny, creating an unfair advantage.
Government-approved journalists receive preferential treatment, which could lead to biased news coverage.
The legislation could financially benefit government-approved journalists at the expense of independent media.
Notable Quotes: This bill is unnecessary and goes against the principles of freedom of the press and democratic values.
The introduction of complex reporting standards and misinformation reports directly attacks their credibility and attempts to ruin their hard-earned reputation.
Government-approved journalists are being given preferential treatment, effectively being 'bribed' for favourable news coverage.
